reviews.review_text: We got the Chefs Tasting platter and it was the perfect way to taste bits of every popular menu. The food presentation was so nice and the combination of food flavours were impeccable (especially with the pomegranate). Thank you to all of the hosts and waiters who were super friendly ! It was truly a fine dining experience.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for you kind words. It was a pleasure our pleasure hosting you.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Vancouver for the first time and we re looking for a middle eastern restaurant, and I m so happy that I found this place! The food was amazing and it tasted straight out of Aleppo. I commend the chef and owner of the restaurant for bringing the quality and authenticity of Syrian food in their dishes served there. This place is a gem and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to have an amazing experience and even better food!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Rania. It was a pleasure having you and your husband. Reviews like yours keep us moving forward. Take care

reviews.review_text: Food was delicious. Wonderful atmosphere with a lovely patio and view of the marina. We ate the Fattouch salad too fast to take a photo. Would highly recommend you try it. It was so fresh. Everything else was also lovely, after sharing the Fatteh hummus with pita and lamb sausages we were happily stuffed. A glass of mint lemonade to wash everything down was the cherry on top of the meal.

We had a wonderful dining experience last night. We met both the owner and chef who greeted us at our table and explained every dish we were treated to. We had the tasting menu and each course was flavourful, fresh and authentic Lebanese and Syrian food. The restaurant is in a perfect location and the staff were friendly, attentive and happy. We loved this experience and cannot wait to return. What a treat!

Yasma is a lovely little gem in coal harbour, slightly tucked away, just off of West Georgia right by the marina. The decor is modern, and the view is spectacular, especially because we went right as the sun set. Each dish is comfortably shared amongst 3 people, unless stated differently. The flavors are so fresh and bold. Make sure to order as much bread as you need to complete the dips and sauces. I went with a group of 10 people and spent roughly $60 per person, with 2 bottles of wine and there were left overs that we split amongst ourselves. Large groups are too big for the venue but they were so lovely by accommodating us.  The service really helped make this place stand out. This place is a great date or venue to bring your best friends, best suited for groups of 4 to 6. So dont dress too casual here, its definitely a place to look a bit more polished when you arrive.

This a great place for those who like Lebanese food. The humus, the salad, the meats were all delicious, served in generous portions. I had lamb kebabs they were perfect. To top it up, creamy ice cream with, yes, more pistachios. The location is awesome, near the water on Denman street. The restaurant is cosy and comfortable. The service is friendly and knowledgeable. We had a great time there.

Quality, unique ingredients, feels like a world of its own with prime location and authentic chic decor inside. All around great service with everything tasting made-from-scratch and home-cooked. Loved it!

Amazing Mediterranean gem in the bay front area with fantastic atmosphere and great food and service! Very authentic and delicious food all the way from Syria and Lebanon, freshly made and tasting like nothing you ever tried before. Nice choice of salads, small mezze plates to share and something for everyone s taste. Several nice vegetarian and vegan options as well. Strongly recommend Fattoush Salad, which is just delicious, hummus is next level, fresh and yummy, and don t get me started on freshly baked pita bread. Place gets very busy on weekends, so make sure to make a booking, although if you are alone or couple, if you are lucky - you may get seated at the bar to admire amazing skills of bartender Anka, who is just doing magic there and  is very helpful and offers great advice. If you love Mediterranean food you ll be in heaven. Vegetarian options: Plenty of vegetarian/ vegan options Dietary restrictions: Food is halal, there are GF and vegetarian and vegan options Parking: Hard to find a parking slot Kid-friendliness: Yes definitely Wheelchair accessibility: Easy

I had the chance to try Yasmas food today and it was amazing! We ordered Fried Kibbeh and Sambousak as hot appetizers. Both dishes were light, crispy and delicious. For the main course we ordered Aleppo Kebab. A kebab made of lamb meat, it was delicious and juicy. It was served with tahini yogurt sauce, roasted onions, red peppers, and parsley onions. It was a perfect match with the small pita bread that came hot and was refreshed whenever we asked for it. I chose Apricot Soda as a drink, it was fresh and tasted great, I would definitely recommend it. Also, the staff is kind and friendly. I look forward to going back many more times. Thank you!

Wonderful food, great service. Authentic Syrian restaurant. As a Syrian I approve and would give this place 100/10 we enjoyed all the dishes that we had. Highly recommend their special which was the lamb shank with rice and frekeh

Finally got to try this place! YAY for unlimited fresh bread - so soft warm and delicious! I came here for my birthday. We ordered the Muhammara, Fatteh Hummus, Fattoush Salad, and Skewer Platterz everything was so delicious, 0 complaints! There wasn t anything complimentary that came with a birthday dinner but thats ok :) Definitely recommend!

I saw this place in a video on Instagram. The food looked appealing and we were visiting Vancouver so it was my first choice on the list and I wasnt disappointed! Our server was top notch, gave us suggestions and recommendations. He had a very funny sense of humor. Service was fast. Mint lemonade a must try! The food was so so so good, and as an Arab I tried many places in Canada, and this is on top of my list now. Hummus was very creamy, and with the combination of the freshly baked pita was so yummy (plus the bread keeps coming for free! Not many restaurants do this. The Tabouleh salad was nicely balanced flavors and dressing and big portions,yalanji was hot and fresh, and the meat was juicy and nicely spiced, oh and the lentil soup so good! Will definitely come back when in Vancouver!

The pictures don t do it justice but everything was delicious! The muhammara was a favourite as was the shish tawouk. The housemade pitas are addictive but don t overeat otherwise you don t have room for other dishes and that s sad. The yolandji (dolma elsewhere) are incredible and slightly sweet. Cant recommend it enough, play it safe and make a reso you dont want to miss out on this place!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Fulya. The Muhammad is differently one of our favourites.

reviews.review_text: Went there for dinner for the first time recently. We enjoyed our dinning experience very much. Will go back to try other dishes on the menu.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Juan. We cant wait to have you dine with us again.

reviews.review_text: Would rate 4.5/5 if possible - 5/5 for service and presentation, 4/5 on flavour. Everything was really fresh, beautifully presented, and the service was very attentive. The flavour was on the milder side - the garlic sauce was mild, the fattoush dressing was light. I think it might depend on what you re looking for, as I like my Lebanese food to be stronger flavoured and I was missing the pomegranate punch in the fattoush salad and the strong garlic intensity in the garlic sauce. The chicken tawouk was good but on the slightly dry side. The lamb burger which was highly recommended was only ok - the meat was a bit fatty and the bun was a bit too much bread (we ended up putting the meat and toppings into their very delicious homemade pita instead - that was much better). The price point is a bit higher for this level of food but the location IS in coal harbour so this was expected. Overall, would come again but with different expectations and for specific dishes.

I visited Yasma on a bustling Saturday night, and to say that it was an extraordinary experience would be an understatement. Despite the restaurant being packed with eager diners, the staff maintained a warm and inviting atmosphere that instantly made us feel welcome. One staff member, in particular, stood out among the rest - Omar. From the moment we sat down his attentive nature and genuine friendliness shone through. He took excellent care of our group, ensuring that we were comfortable and had everything we needed throughout the evening. But what truly set this dining experience apart was the kindness and attentiveness exhibited by Omar. He went above and beyond to ensure we had an extraordinary time, patiently answering our questions, offering insightful suggestions and providing us with an array of delightful and mouthwatering dishes.. His passion for his work and dedication to customer satisfaction were evident in every interaction, making our evening even more memorable. Thanks to Omars exemplary service, we have found a new favorite spot in town. Without a doubt, we will be returning. Thank you, Omar, for making our evening unforgettable!
So yum. Loved the Aleppo Kebab, but get the sense everything is great. The Lebanese wine complements the food perfectly. And service is warm and attentive.

An exceptional dining spot! The food was flawless, bursting with flavor and just exquisite. The staff was incredibly friendly, and the view and atmosphere were both stunning and welcoming. Vegetarian options: Salads

Incredible service, fast, kind, charismatic staff! If you ever wanted to try authentic Mediterranean Lebanese food, this is your go to! We ordered a mix platter of all the kebabs and tawouks and it s the best I ve ever tried! (It looked so good I forgot to take photos of it!) Pistachio Kebab is my favorite! Drinks were amazing! Yasma Mule all the way!

Upon entering the restaurant you can immediately tell that a lot of thought and detail went into it. We were checked in right away and taken to our table which was a little cozier than Id anticipated (tables close to each other) but the view made up for it. The waiters were friendly, knowledgeable and knew the menu items very well. They made any changes we asked for without any issues. The food and desserts were all very tasty and full of flavor. The cubed potatoes were very very spicy as there is fresh Thai chilies mixed in, they were so good I finished the whole thing (you can always ask for no chillies). The pricing is on point, very reasonable for what you get. The only down side is the salad (21 bucks for greens is a bit high) but I still had to try it! Needless to say it was very delicious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to couples and adults enjoying time together (not really Meant for kids). Over all everything was 10/10.. I will definitely return. Keep in mind you do need to call or book a table online.
Yasma located in a prime location and offers a great service. We enjoyed the appetizers and the mint lemonade drink more than the main course. Also, their baklava is an absolute must-try!
In my opinion, best Syrian/Lebanese restaurant on the west coast (Orange County included)

Amazing!!! Everything here feels so heavenly !! We tried the Ramadan iftar menu 10/10 .The Mashawi  were great . Everything was so well spiced and so yummy! The toshka! Amazing!! The service was excellent!! Roza and Omar took great care of our group in a busy friday!  You have to try Qatiyef for dessert! Beyond the boundaries of taste.

Came here with my partner for her birthday and we had a great experience! The staff was super friendly and nice and the food was really good! Highly recommend a sharing style of eating and trying as many dishes as possible. The hummus was so good, and the lamb burger was delicious! The pita bread was super yummy as well. It was all good.

Yasma restaurant is an absolute gem! I had an amazing dining experience here. The ambiance is elegant and cozy, creating a delightful atmosphere. The staff was friendly, attentive, and provided excellent service throughout the evening.

Yasma restaurant is a true gem. The service and hospitality are outstanding, the food is exceptional, and the harbor view adds to its charm. The pleasant atmosphere completes the experience. A must-visit for a memorable dining experience!

Words could not describe the experience we had at Yasma. Unfortunately because they were fully booked and us not having a reservation we were seated at the bar, which was our first and memorable moment. Mo & Dora who took care of us, taught us so much about the restaurant and the food, which would most likely not happen if we were placed at a table. The food we ordered was well presented and delicious. The restaurant is chic, clean, and filled with polite, friendly, and professional dressed staff. If you are looking for a restaurant that is away from all the hustle and bustle with a beautiful view, I recommend this gem! Thank you Mo & Dora for the memorable experience!
We had Ramadan iftar, we could order both the fixed menu and a la cart. Everyone there was so friendly and food tasted like home. Highly recommended if you are into great experiences

Great meal! Great blend of tastes, start off with a brilliant fresh green salad  fatoush , then go wild with a peppericated walnut dish  Muhamara , a sesame chickpea mix  Humus , or try out their seasoned grape leaf wraps  Yalanji . and the fresh hot pita bread is an art class of its own. Excellent experience with great service, right by the marina Vegetarian options: The middle eastern cuisine has Vegan and Vegetarian options that I tried. The salads, starters and even Falafels for main

My wife and I are visiting from Boston. This is our first time eating Syrian/Lebanese food. Staff was friendly. Really appreciated the person recommending the spiced potato dish to us, adding extra olive oil to our eggplant dish, and taking our photos around the restaurant. The spiced potato went so well with the Eggplant mutabbal dish we ordered. My favorite was the Aleppo kebab. The lamb kebab was cooked perfectly and it was so flavorful with the different spices they used. Also loved the charred vegetables and different salads that came with the dish. I knew very little about Mediterranean/middle eastern food, but after yesterday I have a whole new appreciation for how healthy and delicious middle eastern food is.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Hao! We are so glad you enjoyed your experience with us. See you next time :)

reviews.review_text: Being a Vancouverite I m still in awe on how Vancouver s diverse food and culture has grown over the years AND yesterday I had a taste of Lebanese/Syrian food at Yasma. It was absolutely divine! The quality, the flavor, location and ambiance was truly an amazing experience. The staff were professional and friendly even when the restaurant was full they took time to chat and provide a unique middle eastern flair to the evening. It was my first time to have Fatoush salad - amazing! Lamb - flavorful and melts in your mouth. Arabic coffee and cheese/nut pastry for dessert was a beautiful finish to such a wonderful evening. It was like going to the Middle East without leaving my backyard. Truly awesome!

Though the service could improve - i.e. the one and only downside is the level attention that servers could have esp. when restaurant gets busy; sometimes they forgot to bring additional bread we requested or missed what we just told them, so actually we had to tell couple of people the same thing hoping that one would get us what we needed - I believe everything else is great. The food tastes great and fresh! Hummus and Kebabs are must-try.  %
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Apologies about that Herald. We always love to hear customers feedback to keep evolving. Glad you enjoyed your meal. See you next time

reviews.review_text: The food here is amazing! As well as the staff and the decor! I grew up in a Syrian household, and I was soooooo happy to find out a Syrian Lebanese restaurant opened up in Vancouver that has really good quality and great tasting food. The drinks are also really good. Definitely a must try!

Amazing food was served! Grilled chicken and beef, falafel, fried and grilled kibbeh, and a serving of hummus were all on our menu! The setting is upscale, the experience was fantastic, and the view of the coal harbour is fantastic! There are parking lots and on the streets. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and pleasant! For anyone interested in discovering Middle Eastern cuisine and atmosphere (wonderful music), I definitely recommend this location!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Omar for your kind words and positive feedback. We truly appreciate it

reviews.review_text: In a beautiful location on the marina, we got to experience Lebanese and Syrian cuisine like nowhere else in North America: the warmth of home-cooked food blended offered by a very welcoming set of hosts, all in an elevated and refined atmosphere. The  Oud  musicians made us feel all the more transported. We would highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for an authentic taste of the levant.

This is a delightful dining gem! With its warm ambiance and mouth-watering dishes, this eatery offers an unforgettable culinary experience, besides, it s a haven for live music enthusiasts. The in-house band brings an electric atmosphere, perfectly complementing the delicious food, great job Bassem and Bero    Their harmonious tunes and undeniable talent create an unforgettable dining experience. Dont miss the chance to enjoy a fantastic meal accompanied by Yasmas amazing live music. A must-try destination for food lovers in the area!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for your kind feedback

reviews.review_text: One of the best Lebanese restaurants I have ever had, and it is my favorite cuisine! Make sure to get the dips as all of them are dynamic and flavorful. Presentation for take out is outstanding! Will surely begin to recommend!

I loved my experience at Yasma. The food was great and the environment was too. I didnt find the food overly spicy which was great for my group. Everything was plated really nicely. Definitely will be coming back here

Everything was amazing, from the top-notch reception to the amazing service and hospitality by Rosa, and the amazing food. It was just what you need... get the great vibe of the Middle East, Music was also fantabulous... Definitely in my top 3 in Vancouver
Great food! Definitely a restaurant where you share a bunch of dishes. Highly recommend the fattoush and the hummus!! Great service as well. FYI they are not currently doing the tasting menu !

Came with my mom and it was AMAZING. As we re Arab and have spent a lot of time in the Middle East, we ve always felt like the options for proper Arab food were lacking in this city. The first thing we said when we got the food was that it really felt authentic. When we finished, we said that this was one of the few times we felt like we had real Arab food in a restaurant in Vancouver. It s a little pricey but portions are good and it s a great option for a nicer dinner. I m excited to be able to add another good restaurant to my list of recommendations for authentic Lebanese/Syrian food!

The great atmosphere, food and service were great   we ordered Hummus; Babba Ganouch as a starter. It is good enough for 4-5 people. Kibbeh; Kebab and deserts. On top of the authentic atmosphere, the view from the restaurant is beautiful, especially on a sunny day

We showed up without a reservation on a weekday. The place was packed but the maitre D was kind enough to find a spot for us after 15 minutes. The menu is limited which is understandable given they are new and have dinner hours only right how. However, everything was delicious. Our favorite was the skewer of the day which was halloumi and lamb. The chicken was also super flavorful and they really know how to do their potatoes right. We had amazing service from Roza who made us feel very comfortablr. Cant wait to go back.

Delicious syrian dips and meat dishes also. Breads comes together and you can refill, they re also really good. We ordered lamb tartare (kibbeh) and they re exceptionally good, it was very smooth and doesn t taste  meaty  also, it s my fave dish for the night. Their baba ganoush is also very popular, the pure eggplant puree and the generous amount of pomegrate in it makes the whole texture and taste difference. Will come back again with different group of friends.

Yasma is a gem with one of the best Baba Ghanoush and Shish Taouk dishes around. The interior is beautifully designed, and the staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming. To secure a table, its advisable to make a reservation in advance, especially during the busy summer season.
Best hummus I ve had in town. BBQ meat dishes and bread all very delicious. Worth a try!!

Hands down the best Middle Eastern food in town! Only been 7 weeks since they opened! Loved the Ambiance   and amazing service    if you would like to dine-in, make sure you reserve first. Cant wait to be back with more friends and try other dishes
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the positive feedback. Glory Glory

reviews.review_text: Yasma has the elements of greatness.  First the food is really good.  Having lived and worked around the Mediterranean for decades I can honestly say  meals at Yasma rank with the very best in that part of the world.  Second, the staff led by the wonderful Huda is terrific.  She always has a friendly greeting, and the service is attentive, efficient and never obtrusive.  Meals never fail to be enjoyable.  And third, the location along the water rivals Mediterranean harbour view framed by mountains.  When we think of going out for a meal Yasma is generally top of mind. Vegetarian options: One person was vegan and was extremely happy here Wheelchair accessibility: easily accessed

Came here with family and friends, food was very good. Atmosphere was perfect. Really enjoyed all the dishes. The Aleppo kabab and Shish Tawouk were very delicious, I definitely would recommend this to anyone coming here. Desserts were also very delicious.

Looking for a multi sensory experience with a breathtaking view! Yasma is a gem in downtown Vancouver. From the minute you walk in, you re met with the intricate Arabesque backdrop, the fast and friendly service, and the well crafted and delicious food.. Whether you want to celebrate a special occasion or just have the perfect ending to your work week, this is where you d want to go! Thank you, Mariam, Huda, and Polina! Reservations are recommended and pay parking is available off of Bayshore.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Reviews like yours make all the hard work worth it. Looking forward to hosting you  in the future

reviews.review_text: If you have not been here, I suggest you make a trip as soon as possible! I love the Lebanese-Syrian fusion aspect. The restaurant is beautifully laid out and decorated. The staff are amazing. But of course we can t forget the food and how amazing it is. IG: @eatwithzahra

Absolutely amazing food. So fresh and prepared with such a high level of care. Favourite dish was the Kibbeh Nayyeh ( Lebanese lamb tartare) which was outstanding. The owner was explaining how they have a butcher in house who prepares it from fresh local lamb. Other highlights were the Muhammara and Saffron Labneh. The room itself is also beautifully decorated and a very picturesque location near the water.

The food, ambiance and hospitality are top notch at Yasma. Beet Mutabbal, 5/5 if you like beets. Creamy beets and yogurt dip Aleppo Kabab, 5/5 the kabab was rich, tender and full of flavor Yalandji, 5/5 beautifully presented and tasted great too Freshly baked bread on the house We also sampled their baklava, it was gone within seconds of it being served, flaky and not too sweet, as it should be!

Absolutely fantastic food and service. The presentation of traditional Syrian Les Lebanese. Food was excellent vegetables fresh dips-the hummus was amazing. Really one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I ve ever been to. Totally worth a visit and in a great location.

This place is a new favorite! The food was so good! The service was very kind, and they helped me choose on a second dish. The drinks we ordered were also very well made. I will definitely come back here and highly recommend it!

Greeting, location, atmosphere, food everything was amazing, staff named Maryam she is incredible, kind, approachable, explains about each dish, recommend dishes, her smile is so welcoming. It was our first time and will definitely come back. We highly recommend for evening before sunset, after fulfilling tummy it s good to have a walk on coal harbor :)

Fantastic in every way! The food is extremely delicious and great quality. We tried almost all the appetizers and they did not disappoint! The restaurant is in a lovely location with a great patio. Service was fantastic and super prompt. Top notch! Strongly recommend!!!

Delicious food made with pride  and friendly service. We tried the hummus, lamb burger and fries, Toshka and fries. Technically the Toshka came with fries but the owner was nice enough to oblige my request to swap it for a small Tabouleh. The lamb burger was delicious. The caramelized onions and herbs really elevated it. The Toshka had tender lamb and melted halloumi cheese sandwiched inside perfectly grilled pita. I believe it had pomegranate molasses drizzled over it.  It was the perfect finish for this dish. The small tabouleh was pretty generous for a  small . It was fresh and yummy. The decor in the restaurant is tastefully done with pieces imported from Lebanon.  It has a cozy, intimate ambience. We re looking forward to coming back when they re open for dine it.

After all the headache of lost luggage, delayed and canceled flights, Yasma gave us a huge break. The best food ever and the staff are all so nice. Mariam , you deserve all the credit for making us so comfortable that we went back again. Omar never stops smiling even though he is running around all the time. My choice is never the best but I won this time. My order of Toshka was the best and Grape leaves ( I had never tasted before) were excellent. The hummus , the Baba Ghanoush, the Salad and every dish was great. Dana , the Bartender at one point came to help them and was so good. Music on Friday was a huge plus point with the food to make it a right choice. We highly recommend Yasma .

The full experience of the mediterranean . Authentic , modern, chic. From the moment I entered I was greeted warmly in the foyer by a lovely hostess . We didn t have a reservation but they happily gave us a walk in spot within 45 minutes. A very kind and generous offer considering it was mother days and we failed beforehand to make a reservation. Once inside Yasma Restaurant, my eyes were doused in visual astonishment.The design aesthetic upon entry was breathtaking. Adorned with a beautiful colour palette one would expect when visiting the mediterranean. Blues , woodsy browns and a charming hue of warm amber enchanted my eyes as I was lead to my table. Houda was our server for the evening. Impeccable , authentic hospitality. It was as if she welcomed us into her home and dining room. She presented us with our menus and indulged us on the evening specials. After, she gave us her personal recommendations of what is a must try ( quite frankly , everything on the menu is a must try in my opinion). Houda was extremely knowledgeable of the ingredients of each dish and this greatly helped in making our selections. Thank you Houda, you truly understand hospitality and how to do hosting the right way! The cocktails were divine. Expert mixologist working at the bar. A great asset to the restaurant. The flavours were spot on, balanced and just the right proportions of sweet/acidity. The dishes , upon first bite brought me to internal tears as it pierced my heart heart strings and reminded me of my Lebanese grandmothers cooking , (the cooking she made for family dinner parties). Every ounce of flavour one would hope for was present! The evening was adorned with light music by a guitarist. I felt transported to middle east.  Wonderful Syrian hospitality memory and one that will very much keep me coming back for more. Thank you for opening this culinary jewel for Vancouver. A customer for life! Loving Regards Serge Elkhouri

Loved the vibe! They were full due to Ramadan and Iftaar, but we were able to sit in the bar! The bartender and everyone in the restaurant was well behaved! The food was great! They also have unique drinks (a Syrian version of the popular cocktails)! I enjoyed my time fully! Next time well make a reservation and enjoy outlet time for a longer period!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Ali for your visits. We would love to book you a table next time.

reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing place to eat, with Excellent service, and a good menu... not overly extensive. The food was very good quality all around
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Marjan. Very kind of you to leave such a great feedback.

reviews.review_text: It is one of the best Lebanese/ Syrian restaurants in Vancouver overlooking the waterfront of coal harbour. The team is friendly &  food quality is at high standard. Excellent service and ambiance

This is definitely one of the best restaurants in Vancouver and I ve been to a lot of places. The food is fresh, delicious and cooked to perfection. The staff was also extremely friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great place to eat.

Came here with my family and had a great time. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was top notch. Will be back Second review 4 months apart This place continues to exceed our expectations. Great food made by awesome people. Rosa was awesome and made us feel like family. We will be back for sure. Massive congratulations on your success thus far

Great food, amazing location and really enjoyable experience! The daily kebab special was my favourite. They have a beautiful view of the marina and water, and the surrounding area is fantastic on a sunny day.

Yasma offers a refreshingly modern dining experience that pays homage to its Middle Eastern roots without overwhelming the senses. The restaurants atmosphere is a tasteful nod to contemporary aesthetics, providing a sophisticated backdrop where the heritage of the cuisine can shine. The menu is thoughtfully curated, featuring a selection of dishes that are rooted in tradition yet presented with a modern flair. Each recipe is a careful composition of flavors that are indicative of the regions gastronomic legacy, such as the richly spiced lamb and the tender, grilled vegetables. Shadi, our gracious host, added an extra layer of enjoyment to our visit with his attentive service and his knack for suggesting the perfect dish to suit our tastes. The team around him was equally impressive, striking the right balance between professionalism and personal touch to make our evening at Yasma truly special. For a genuine taste of Middle Eastern hospitality with a contemporary twist, Yasma is a destination that should not be missed. Thanks to Shadi and the entire staff, we left with a deeper appreciation for the subtle artistry that defines this wonderful establishment.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Ehsan , Thank you for your kind words and detailed review, It means the world to us. See you soon

reviews.review_text: Great experience, view, and of course the food. Reccomendations for food + drink were very much appreciated and in-depth. Staff was very personable and accomodating. Hard to go wrong with anything on the menu, sharing is encouraged.

My friends and I have had the pleasure to eat at Yasma. Hiba was very understanding and friendly. She gave us a great table even if we did not have a reservation. Paulina was very sweet and offered great service. The food was very authentic and fresh. Thank you for having us, we will be back! Ali

Almost the best Arabic restaurant you can find in Vancouver. Food was absolutely delicious and the atmosphere was nice and the server was friendly and informative. Very good experience. We will come back again for sure.

The Yasma team were absolutely amazing dealing with a table of 12!! They were very accommodating to our demands and always attentive. The team really made our experience at Yasma amazing. Thank you again. The food was delicious and full of flavour. Everything we had tasted wonderful shish tawouk, tabouli, fattoush, kebbeh, Hommus, mtabal, Baba ghanouj, Spicey potato . Every thing was just great! My favourite ending is the pomegranate lemon sorbet that took me back to Beirut s summer nights! I can t recommend this enough.

This is by far the best Lebanese resturant in Canada. Sorry Montreal resturants, but the vote goes to Yasma, Vancouver. The owner Mohamad is such a nice, welcoming, and generous. The service is outstanding.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Hasan. Looking forward to host you again.

reviews.review_text: Lovely room with loads of natural light and modern decor.  Delicious food with loads of options to share. The pita bread was awesome. Best Ive ever had.

Amazing food with great service. Our server, Shadi, went above and beyond to connect with us and make our experience one to remember. 10/10 Highly recommended! Wheelchair accessibility: Same level entrance, tables, bar, & restrooms.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Nazanin. Very glad you enjoyed your experience.

reviews.review_text: OMG!!! So YUMMY! I have heard a few people mention this restaurant and we just had to try Yasma out ! Lebanese style food is my favourite and they really did an amazing job. The restaurant itself is beautiful   amazing vibes and the staff is very passionate and knowledgeable. A fabulous experience from start to finish . 10/10 recommend.
We had read how great the food, service and wine list were however were still blown away! Not only did it over deliver on above but really well priced too. We will definitely return.

We brought a bunch of friends here and the restaurant was so helpful and accommodating as we made the plans over the prior weeks. The food was excellent, the service was stellar, and the patio was divine. I would definitely go back again and again.

Knocked it out of the park! My wife and I had a wonderful date night at Yasma with many thanks to Mariam for her wonderful service. Im excited for our next visit as there were to many things on the menu that I was too full to try.
Very nice restaurant, very good view and a delicious Arabic/Syrian food.
Delicious food, service was fast and friendly.  The location is very beautiful by the seawall and the cocktails are also great! Will be back with the whole family!

What a great takeout experience, from pickup to packaging (see photos). The food is amazing, well done guys. Good to see such awesome food starting to emerge here in Vancouver. Now if you push me for critical feedback here is some to make the food even better - great salad (fattoush) but wrong choice of onion. Too overpowering - eggplant muttabal is also good but needs a bit more salt - the lamb burger is just divine. No improvements can be made there. Damn!

It was one of the best of not the best dinners I have had. A very soft and invigorating setting and the delicious servings which thenself were generous enough made for an unforgettable evening. Will come here again.
The muhammara was phenomenal!! Overall delicious meal!

Very nice place and atmosphere, the food is excellent, absolutely delicious, the staff are very friendly, especially Omar. Yasma is one of our favourite restaurant to go to, and always we enjoy the experience. Food

This was our second time at Yasma and the food and service did not disappoint. Wonderful and authentic flavours with great presentation at a reasonable price.  We will be back next time we are in Vancouver.

The service is amazing with some of the best Arab food I ve had in all of Canada. It is on the pricier side, but the quality of food is worth it. They also had some live music that added to the ambiance. The vibes are immaculate and the food is exquisite. You must go here if you re visiting Vancouver!
Was SO amazing! Service was great, food delicious & the owner came over and was so lovely and hospitable. HIGHLY Recommend!!! Also vibe and location are on point.

So good that we forgot to take photos before eating!! We ordered 4 dips, Yalandji, and Shish Kibbeh. Def too much food for 2 adults and 2 kids, but completely okay with us because well happily eat everything for breakfast and lunch tomorrow! The plating is so beautiful - people actually stopped us at the beach to ask where we got our food from because it looked so good! A bit tricky to figure out the pickup, but that was mostly because we didnt read our instructions very well. Highly recommended!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We are so glad you enjoyed your meal on the beach.

reviews.review_text: Had a fantastic time tonight; thank you to Huda and Omar for being so attentive and suggesting great menu items! I would highly recommend this restaurant to everyone; the ambience, the food and the live music were just flawless. We had the muhammara, fattoush salad, aleppo kebab and shish tawouk which were all perfectly seasoned,  in generous portions and beautifully presented. Sadly half the plates were demolished before I could take good photos!  My middle eastern mother who herself is a great cook,  was left impressed! The highlight of the night was having a qatayif and Lebanese coffee whilst listening to Um Kulthum... cant really get better than that. Will definitely be back when Im in Vancouver again and being more family!
It s my first time trying Syrian/Lebanese food and it s beyond amazing. Everything s so beautiful and looks like art. Wow. I agree that I ve never had anything like this before. I m obsessed
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We really appreciate it.

reviews.review_text: It s been a while since I had delicious Syrian cuisine!! And lovely and great people! Highly recommend the Fatteh Hummus!

Great customer service, friendly staff, delicious food and great vibes, we ordered a lot of food and everything was excellent, our host was extremely professional and so friendly, she went above and beyond the service . The place a bit pricey but worth it. Highly recommend Can t wait to go there again.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Mohammed. We really appreciate your feedback.

reviews.review_text: By far, this is the best Middle Eastern restaurant in metro Vancouver. The Hummus and grilled meats taste very authentic. We will definitely be back.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Mr Farid for your kind feedback.

reviews.review_text: Yasma is one of my favourite restaurants in Vancouver! Their food is very-very delicious, service is always on the top level and the atmosphere is very nice. Can t wait to be back!

Finally an authentic Lebanese restaurant in downtown Vancouver!  It did not disappoint in any way.  Fresh, perfectly seasoned dishes with amazing textures and appealing presentation. Every dish we ordered (and we ordered lots) impressed us and our server was knowledgeable and friendly.  First time having Kibbe Nayeh in Vancouver (had it many times in Montreal, not to mention Lebanon and Damascus) and it was made with love and attention to detail.  The fresh bread kept coming and the Lebanese wine kept on being poured.  My only wish is that they don t change a thing and maintain consistent quality as well as the reasonable prices because we will definitely be back!
Amazing iftar, amazing food, the hospitality is unmatched   extremely welcoming   The owner (girl) was so sweet and down to earth Im coming back for her!!
The best Lebanese dining experience in Canada.
I recommend you to try this restaurant if you are looking for different tastes and seasonings.

Yasma is what Vancouver has been lacking for a long while. Authentic Syrian food. The yalanji is highly recommended as well as their fatteh. For dessert qatayef b joz (walnut stuffed pastry with sugar syrup and rosewater) are chef s kiss. The staff are extremely friendly and very accommodating
First time trying out Syrians and Lebanons cuisine. Very fresh and healthy food. Highly recommend that anyone interested in cuisine should try.
